verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329><s%> Musician <S%H5329><s%> upon Neginah, <S%H5058><s%> A Psalm of David. <S%H1732><s%> Hear <S%H8085><s%> my cry, <S%H7440><s%> O God; <S%H430><s%> attend <S%H7181><s%> to my prayer. <S%H8605><s%>

From the end <S%H7097><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> will I cry <S%H7121><s%> to you, when my heart <S%H3820><s%> is overwhelmed: <S%H5848><s%> lead <S%H5148><s%> me to the rock <S%H6697><s%> that is higher <S%H7311><s%> than I.
For you have been <S%H1961><s%> a shelter <S%H4268><s%> for me, and a strong <S%H5797><s%> tower <S%H4026><s%> from the enemy. <S%H341><s%>
I will abide <S%H1481><s%> in your tabernacle <S%H168><s%> for ever: <S%H5769><s%> I will trust <S%H2620><s%> in the covert <S%H5643><s%> of your wings. <S%H3671><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
For you, O God, <S%H430><s%> have heard <S%H8085><s%> my vows: <S%H5088><s%> you have given <S%H5414><s%> me the heritage <S%H3425><s%> of those that fear <S%H3373><s%> your name. <S%H8034><s%>
You will prolong <S%H3254><s%> the king's <S%H4428><s%> life: <S%H3117><s%> <S%H5921><s%> and his years <S%H8141><s%> as many <S%H7227><s%> generations. <S%H1755><s%>
He shall abide <S%H3427><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> God <S%H430><s%> for ever: <S%H5769><s%> O prepare <S%H4487><s%> mercy <S%H2617><s%> and truth, <S%H571><s%> which may preserve <S%H5341><s%> him.
So <S%H3651><s%> will I sing <S%H2167><s%> praise to your name <S%H8034><s%> for ever, <S%H5703><s%> that I may daily <S%H3117><s%> perform <S%H7999><s%> my vows. <S%H5088><s%>
